workflow.name: Send WooCommerce cross-sell offers to customers via WhatsApp using Rapiwa API
workflow.description:
## Who Is This For?
This n8n workflow enables **automated cross-selling** by identifying each **WooCommerce customer's** most frequently purchased product, **finding a related product to recommend**, and **sending a personalized WhatsApp message** using the **Rapiwa API**. It also verifies whether the user's number is WhatsApp-enabled before sending, and logs both successful and unsuccessful attempts to Google Sheets for tracking.


## What This Workflow Does
- Retrieves all paying customers from your WooCommerce store  
- Identifies each customer's most purchased product  
- Finds the latest product in the same category as their most purchased item  
- Cleans and verifies customer phone numbers for WhatsApp compatibility  
- Sends personalized WhatsApp messages with product recommendations  
- Logs all activities to Google Sheets for tracking and analysis  
- Handles both verified and unverified numbers appropriately  

## Key Features
- **Customer Segmentation:** Automatically identifies paying customers from your WooCommerce store  
- **Product Analysis:** Determines each customer's most purchased product  
- **Smart Recommendations:** Finds the latest products in the same category as customer favorites  
- **WhatsApp Integration:** Uses Rapiwa API for message delivery  
- **Phone Number Validation:** Verifies WhatsApp numbers before sending messages  
- **Dual Logging System:** Tracks both successful and failed message attempts in Google Sheets  
- **Rate Limiting:** Uses batching and wait nodes to prevent API overload  
- **Personalized Messaging:** Includes customer name and product details in messages  

## Requirements
- WooCommerce store with API access  
- Rapiwa account with API access for WhatsApp verification and messaging  
- Google account with Sheets access  
- Customer phone numbers in WooCommerce (stored in `billing.phone` field)  

## How to Use ‚Äî Step-by-Step Setup
### 1. Credentials Setup
 - **WooCommerce API:** Configure WooCommerce API credentials in n8n (e.g., "WooCommerce (get customer)" and "WooCommerce (get customer data)")  
 - **Rapiwa Bearer Auth:** Create an HTTP Bearer credential with your Rapiwa API token  
 - **Google Sheets OAuth2:** Set up OAuth2 credentials for Google Sheets access  

### 2. Configure Google Sheets
 - Ensure your sheet has the required columns as specified in the **Google Sheet Column Structure** section  

### 3. Verify Code Nodes
 - **Code (get paying_customer):** Filters customers to include only those who have made purchases  
 - **Get most buy product id & Clear Number:** Identifies the most purchased product and cleans phone numbers  

### 4. Configure HTTP Request Nodes
 - **Get customer data:** Verify the WooCommerce API endpoint for retrieving customer orders  
 - **Get specific product data:** Verify the WooCommerce API endpoint for product details  
 - **Get specific product recommend latest product:** Verify the WooCommerce API endpoint for finding latest products by category  
 - **Check valid WhatsApp number Using Rapiwa:** Verify the Rapiwa endpoint for WhatsApp number validation  
 - **Rapiwa Sender:** Verify the Rapiwa endpoint for sending messages  

## Google Sheet Required Columns
You‚Äôll need two Google Sheets (or two tabs in one spreadsheet):
**A Google Sheet formatted like this** ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1yTxkAM1kq2udndvG5M2jUuQCY8SkvoLgrspQ100LvKs/edit?usp=sharing)
The workflow uses a Google Sheet with the following columns to track coupon distribution:
Both must have the following headers (match exactly):

| name       | number      | email  | address1    | price | suk | title   | product link   | validity   | staus    |
| ---------- | ------------- | ----------------------------------------------- | ----------- | ----- | --- | ---------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------- | -------- |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827799 | [contact@spagreen.net](mailto:contact@spagreen.net) | mirpur dohs | 850   |     | Sharp Most Demanding Hoodie x Nike |  [https://your_shop_domain/p-img-nike](https:your_shop_domain/p-img-nike-3/)  | verified   | sent     |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827799 | [contact@spagreen.net](mailto:contact@spagreen.net) | mirpur dohs | 850   |     | Sharp Most Demanding Hoodie x Nike | [https://your_shop_domain/p-img-nike](https:your_shop_domain/p-img-nike-3/) | unverified | not sent |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827799 | [contact@spagreen.net](mailto:contact@spagreen.net) | mirpur dohs | 850   |     | Sharp Most Demanding Hoodie x Nike | [https://your_shop_domain/p-img-nike](https:your_shop_domain/p-img-nike-3/) | verified   | sent     |


## Important Notes
- **Phone Number Format:** The workflow cleans phone numbers by removing all non-digit characters. Ensure your WooCommerce phone numbers are in a compatible format.  
- **API Rate Limits:** Rapiwa and WooCommerce APIs have rate limits. Adjust batch sizes and wait times accordingly.  
- **Data Privacy:** Ensure compliance with data protection regulations when sending marketing messages.  
- **Error Handling:** The workflow logs unverified numbers but doesn't have extensive error handling. Consider adding error notifications for failed API calls.  
- **Product Availability:** The workflow recommends the latest product in a category, but doesn't check if it's in stock. Consider adding stock status verification.  
- **Testing:** Always test with a small batch before running the workflow on your entire customer list.  

## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)

## Support & Help
- **WhatsApp**: [Chat on WhatsApp](https://wa.me/8801322827799)
- **Discord**: [SpaGreen Community](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)
- **Facebook Group**: [SpaGreen Support](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)
- **Website**: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)
- **Developer Portfolio**: [Codecanyon SpaGreen](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

documentId.cachedResultName: Send WooCommerce Cross-Sell Offers to Customers via WhatsApp Using Rapiwa API

parameters.content:
# Send WooCommerce Cross-Sell Offers to Customers via WhatsApp Using Rapiwa API

## Overview
This n8n workflow enables **automated cross-selling** by identifying each **WooCommerce customer's** most frequently purchased product, **finding a related product to recommend**, and **sending a personalized WhatsApp message** using the **Rapiwa API**. It also verifies whether the user's number is WhatsApp-enabled before sending, and logs both successful and unsuccessful attempts to Google Sheets for tracking.


## Features
- Loops through all customers with at least one completed order.
- Detects the most frequently purchased product for each customer.
- Fetches a related (upsell/cross-sell) product for recommendation.
- Verifies if the customer's phone number is registered on WhatsApp using Rapiwa.
- Sends a templated cross-sell promo message through WhatsApp.
- Logs verified/sent vs. unverified/not sent messages in Google Sheets.
- Controls rate with SplitInBatches and Wait to prevent spamming or rate-limiting.

## Requirements
- n8n instance (self-hosted or cloud)
- WooCommerce API credentials with read access
- Rapiwa account with a valid token (for message & verification APIs)
- Google Sheets access & OAuth2 credentials
- WooCommerce store with real purchase data and related product configurations


## Google Sheet Required Columns
You‚Äôll need two Google Sheets (or two tabs in one spreadsheet):
**A Google Sheet formatted like this** ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1yTxkAM1kq2udndvG5M2jUuQCY8SkvoLgrspQ100LvKs/edit?usp=sharing)

## How to Use This Workflow
### Step 1: Setup Credentials
- Add your WooCommerce, Rapiwa, and Google Sheets credentials in n8n Credentials.
- Make sure Rapiwa token is set up as HTTP Bearer Auth.

### Step 2: Prepare Your Google Sheets
- Create a sheet with the columns listed above.
- Copy its URL and paste the Sheet ID into the appropriate nodes in the workflow.

### Step 3: Import Workflow
- Use the Import feature in n8n and load your provided JSON file.

### Step 4: Configure the Flow
- Check Code nodes (Find Most Purchased Product, Format WhatsApp Number) to ensure data structure matches your WooCommerce setup.
- Customize the WhatsApp message template in the Send Message via Rapiwa node.

### Step 5: Test It
- Start with test users or your own number to validate WhatsApp message formatting and delivery.


## Notes & Warnings
- Make sure the Rapiwa API responses are parsed properly (`data.exists === true`).
- If your WooCommerce product data uses variations or custom meta, adjust the product lookup nodes.
- Phone number cleaning must ensure the format matches E.164 format (e.g., 8801XXXXXXXXX).
- Monitor Rapiwa rate limits‚Äîtoo many failed verifications may lead to temporary bans.
- Always test with a small user batch before going full production.


## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)

## Support & Help
- **WhatsApp**: [Chat on WhatsApp](https://wa.me/8801322827799)
- **Discord**: [SpaGreen Community](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)
- **Facebook Group**: [SpaGreen Support](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)
- **Website**: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)
- **Developer Portfolio**: [Codecanyon SpaGreen](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

## Get Many Customers
**Purpose:** Retrieves all customer records from WooCommerce  
**How it works:**  
- Fetches complete customer dataset including purchase history  
**Output:** Raw customer data with purchase details  

---

## Code (Get Paying Customer)
**Purpose:** Filters customers to identify only those with purchase history  
**How it works:**  
- Analyzes `total_spent` and `is_paying_customer` fields  
- Creates a new array containing only paying customers

## Schedule Trigger
**Purpose:** Initiates the workflow at specified intervals  
**How it works:**  
- Configured with time-based triggers (e.g., daily, weekly)

## Get Customer Data
**Purpose:** Retrieves detailed order history for each customer  
**How it works:**  
- Makes API call to WooCommerce with customer ID  
- Fetches all orders associated with the customer  
**API Endpoint:**  
```
https://your_shop_domain/wp-json/wc/v3/orders?customer={{ $json.id }}
```



## Get Most Buy Product ID & Clear Number
**Purpose:** Identifies customer's most purchased product and cleans phone number  
**How it works:**  
- Analyzes order line items to find the product with the highest quantity purchased  
- Removes all non-digit characters from the phone number

## Get Specific Product Data
**Purpose:** Retrieves detailed information about the most purchased product  
**How it works:**  
- Makes an API call to WooCommerce using the product ID  
- Fetches product details including category information  
**API Endpoint:**  
```
https://your_shop_domain/wp-json/wc/v3/products/{{ $json.product_id }}
```

## Code (Clean Data)
**Purpose:** Extracts and formats product category information
**How it works:**
- Processes product categories for recommendation logic
- Structures data for category-based product search
**Output:** Product data with category IDs for recommendation search

## Get Specific Product Recommend Latest Product
**Purpose:** Finds the latest product in the same category as customer's favorite
**How it works:**
- Makes API call to WooCommerce with category ID

**API Endpoint:**
```
https://your_shop_domain/wp-json/wc/v3/products?category={{ $json.categories[0].id }}&orderby=date&order=desc&per_page=1
```

## Check Valid WhatsApp Number Using Rapiwa
**Purpose:** Verifies if customer's phone number is registered on WhatsApp
**How it works:**
- Sends POST request to Rapiwa verification endpoint
- Uses Bearer Token authentication

### If (Decision Node)
**Purpose:** Routes workflow based on WhatsApp verification result  

## Rapiwa Sender
**Purpose:** Sends personalized WhatsApp message with product recommendation  
**How it works:**  
- Constructs message with customer name and product details  
**API Endpoint:**  
`https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message`


## Save State of Rows in Verified & Sent
**Purpose:** Logs successful message delivery to Google Sheets  
**How it works:**  
- Appends row with customer and product details  
- Marks as "verified" and "sent"  


## Save State of Rows in Unverified & Not Sent
**Purpose:** Logs unverified numbers to Google Sheets  
**How it works:**  
- Appends row with same details as above  
- Marks as "unverified" and "not sent" 

## Wait
**Purpose:** Adds delay between customer processing

parameters.message:
=Hello {{ $('get most buy product id & Clear Number').item.json.customer_name }},

Thanks again for your recent purchase! üéÅ  
We thought you might also love *{{ $('get specific product recommend latest product').item.json.name }}* - it‚Äôs a favorite among our customers who bought something similar.

Only *BDT {{ $('get specific product recommend latest product').item.json.price }}* ‚Äì limited stock!  
Check it out üëâ {{ $('get specific product recommend latest product').item.json.permalink }}

Let us know if you need any help.
- Team *SpaGreen Creative*

user.name: Rapiwa
user.bio:
Simple, Reliable, Cost-Effective WhatsApp API
Rapiwa is a fast, reliable WhatsApp Business API Solution built for developers. Manage multiple sessions, scale your messaging, and enjoy transparent pricing with no per-message fees.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
